introduction: Welcome to a session on Human-Computer Interaction and User Interface Design. The session is hosted by Tony Tang, an Associate Professor at the University of Toronto, and Anastasia Kuzminik, a Professor at the same institution. The session is part of Infocon 2021 and focuses on mapping problems, making humans and computers understand each other, and designing interfaces for different scenarios and user groups.

sections.title: Section 1: Mapping Problems
content: Explanation of mapping problems and their importance in user experience design.
Introduction of the two design solutions presented in the session: one with icons next to the thing to plug in and another with a machine that gives change in coins only.
Discussion on the limitations of these solutions and the need for more effective communication between humans and computers.
Overview of the development of machine intelligence and its impact on human-computer interaction.

sections.title: Section 2: Understanding User Perception
content: Explanation of the five categories of human perception in proximix, a field of study concerned with how people organize their space and territory.
Discussion on how these categories differ for different ages and how they affect user experience design.
Overview of the importance of understanding user perception in designing effective interfaces.
Presentation of examples of how different categories can be applied in user interface design.

sections.title: Section 3: Collaborative and Competitive Scenarios
content: Explanation of how collaborative and competitive scenarios can affect user interface design.
Discussion on the importance of adapting interfaces for different scenarios and user groups.
Overview of design principles for collaborative and competitive scenarios.
Presentation of examples of how these principles can be applied in user interface design.

sections.title: Section 4: Territoriality and Praxamics
content: Explanation of territoriality and praxamics in the context of user interface design.
Discussion on how these concepts can influence user experience and interface design.
Overview of design principles for territoriality and praxamics.
Presentation of examples of how these principles can be applied in user interface design.

sections.title: Section 5: Leave from Wherever You Are
content: Introduction to the next session,
skills for an evolving profession.
Overview of the session's focus on skills needed for the future of work.
Presentation of the speakers and their expertise in the field.
Discussion on the importance of staying updated with the latest trends and technologies in the industry.
